messages.content:
You are a world state generator for a workplace benchmark. Your job is to transform an abstract scenario into a concrete, detailed world_state JSON.

The world_state should include:
1. All metadata from the scenario (scenario_id, description, noise_level, depth, global_settings, people, projects)
2. sub_scenarios_expanded: For each abstract sub_scenario from the input scenario, create a concrete expanded version with:
   - Concrete ISO datetime timestamps
   - Specific participant IDs/emails
   - Detailed event descriptions
   - Any seeds needed for data generation
   - This array should contain ONLY the expanded versions of the sub_scenarios listed in the input scenario
3. noise_scenarios: An array of noise-only scenario objects that are NOT part of the core sub_scenarios:
   - These should be realistic but unrelated workplace events/messages/activities
   - Each noise scenario should have similar structure to sub_scenarios_expanded (id, type, timestamps, participants, etc.)
   - The number of noise scenarios should scale with the noise_level parameter

IMPORTANT: Do NOT include per_source_plans in the world_state. The world_state is scenario-centric only.

IMPORTANT PARAMETERS:
- noise_level (0-1): Controls amount of unrelated/off-task data
  * 0 = almost no noise, only data directly relevant to sub_scenarios (noise_scenarios should be empty or minimal)
  * 1 = lots of unrelated messages/events/files (still realistic) (noise_scenarios should contain many entries)
- depth (0-1): Controls how indirect the evidence is
  * 0 = sub_scenario realized directly (e.g., one clear Slack message)
  * 1 = sub_scenario requires multi-step, multi-source chaining to infer
  * Intermediate values interpolate behavior

CRITICAL: sub_scenarios_expanded must correspond exactly to the sub_scenarios in the input scenario. All other unrelated scenarios should go in noise_scenarios.

You must output ONLY valid JSON matching the world_state schema. Do not include markdown code fences.

raw_message.content:
{

  "sub_scenarios_expanded": [
    {
      "id": "planning_meeting_complex_2",

      ],

      },

      "expanded": {
        "reference_week": {
          "start_date": "2025-11-17",
          "end_date": "2025-11-21",
          "note": "Next week relative to initial scheduling discussion on 2025-11-10."
        },
        "events": [
          {
            "event_id": "planning_meeting_complex_2_evt1",
            "channel": "email",
            "timestamp": "2025-11-10T10:05:00+09:00",
            "from": "alex.smith@company.com",
            "to": [
              "sam.williams@company.com"
            ],
            "cc": [

            ],
            "subject": "Initial Data Migration Planning Session",
            "body": "Hi Sam,\n\nFollowing up on DAT-101 and the upcoming Planning milestone on 2025-11-10, I'd like to get us together for a Data Migration working session.\n\nProposed time: Thu 2025-11-13, 15:00–15:45 (Asia/Seoul)\nParticipants: you, Jordan and me.\n\nLet me know if that slot works; if not, we can move it to sometime next week during working hours.\n\nThanks,\nAlex",

              "person_sam_williams",
              "person_jordan_johnson"
            ],

            "start": "2025-11-13T15:00:00+09:00",

              "person_jordan_johnson"
            ],

          {
            "event_id": "planning_meeting_complex_2_evt3",

            ],

            "participants": [
              "person_jordan_johnson",
              "person_alex_smith",
              "person_sam_williams"
            ],
            "thread_id": "proj-dat-migration-thread-382",

            ],

              "person_jordan_johnson",
              "person_sam_williams"
            ],
            "thread_id": "proj-dat-migration-thread-382",

            "channel": "email",
            "timestamp": "2025-11-11T16:35:00+09:00",
            "from": "sam.williams@company.com",
            "to": [
              "alex.smith@company.com"
            ],

            ],

            "body": "Hi Alex,\n\nNext week works better for me as well. I’m in a design review Monday 11/17 from 13:00–14:00, but otherwise my afternoons are free.\n\nCould we lock in Tue 11/18, 14:00–14:45 for the Data Migration planning with Jordan?\n\nThanks,\nSam",
            "participants": [

            ],

          },

            "description": "Rescheduled planning session for DAT project.\n\nAgenda:\n1. Review DAT-100 completion and current DAT-101 status\n2. Define next sprint scope for Data Migration\n3. Identify risks and dependencies\n\nRescheduled from 2025-11-13 15:00–15:45 to accommodate support rotation.",
            "start": "2025-11-18T14:00:00+09:00",
            "end": "2025-11-18T14:45:00+09:00",

            "from": "alex.smith@company.com",
            "to": [

              "jordan.johnson@company.com"
            ],
            "subject": "Updated invite: Data Migration Planning (Rescheduled to 11/18)",
            "body": "Hi both,\n\nI’ve updated the calendar invite for our Data Migration planning session.\n\nNew time: Tue 11/18, 14:00–14:45 (Asia/Seoul)\nAttendees: Alex Smith (PM), Sam Williams (Senior Engineer), Jordan Johnson (Engineer)\n\nThis replaces the earlier hold on Thu 11/13.\n\nBest,\nAlex",

              "person_sam_williams",
              "person_jordan_johnson"
            ],

                "end": "2025-11-13T15:45:00+09:00"
              },
              "new_time": {
                "start": "2025-11-18T14:00:00+09:00",
                "end": "2025-11-18T14:45:00+09:00"
              }
            }
          }
        ],
        "inference_summary": "Alex originally set a tentative Data Migration planning meeting with Sam and Jordan for 2025-11-13 15:00–15:45. Jordan then indicated on Slack that he could not attend due to support rotation, prompting Alex to explicitly suggest moving the meeting to \"next week\" and propose afternoon slots. Sam replied by email proposing Tue 2025-11-18 14:00–14:45, which Jordan confirmed in Slack. Alex then created a new confirmed calendar event \"Data Migration Planning (Rescheduled)\" on 2025-11-18 14:00–14:45 with Alex, Sam, and Jordan as participants, and sent an update email stating that this replaces the earlier hold. Evidence is distributed across email, Slack, and calendar, requiring cross-referencing to see that the meeting has been rescheduled to next week within working hours for approximately 45 minutes."
      }
    }
  ],
